comments.html: My bet for the elephant in the room is congestion delay. Using a congestion control mechanism that keeps buffer utilization (and thus buffer delay) low, such as Datacenter TCP, is probably much more relevant than having a low forwarding latency in the intermediate devices. For example, an average occupancy of 20 packets per input buffer increases latency by 24 μs when using 10G, way larger than typical zero-load forwarding latency.
comments.name: Enrique Vallejo
